greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest prime starting a sequence of 2n consecutive primes with symmetrical gaps about the center.
link: N. Makarova and others, Distributed computing project, discussion at the scientific forum dxdy.ru (in Russian), Feb. 2015.
example: The first term is 2 since the 2 primes 2, 3 have a gap of 1, which is trivially symmetric about its center.
The second term is 5 since the 4 primes 5, 7, 11, 13 have gaps 2, 4, 2, which is symmetric about its center.
program: (PARI) A081235(n) = { my(last=vector(n*=2,i,prime(i)), m, i=Mod(n-2,n)); forprime(p=last[n],default(primelimit), m=last[1+lift(i+2)]+last[1+lift(i++)]=p; for(j=1,n\2,last[1+lift(i-j)]+last[1+lift(i+j+1)]==m||next(2)); return(last[1+lift(i+1)]))} \\ _M. F. Hasler_, Apr 02 2010
results.author: _Christopher Hunt Gribble_ and _T. D. Noe_, Apr 02 2010
ext: a(11) from _Dmitry Petukhov_, added by _Max Alekseyev_, Aug 08 2014
a(12) from an anonymous participant of the project, added by _Natalia Makarova_, Jul 16 2015
